topics.body:
Today I continue to confirm to myself the pissy nature of Legends of Equestria forum mods.

All I need to do is post simple, safe, Derpibooru search results. And even when there's no tits, guns, or guts they'll get mad. Other people will too. Apparently this place is on their aversion list, alongside Ponychan and 4chan.

Never mind how when I visit /mlp/ or some such forum I feel considerably underwhelmed. They kick up such a fuss about it, you'd expect I'd be on my way to a mental hospital for lurking.
topics.author: 4fe4bf947f123b175b000001

topics.body:
"@AaronMk":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5397d3fa63687266ad570200#post_5397d3fa63687266ad570200
Ah, the "we won't be associated with the perverted" purists. Probably the worst type of fan.
topics.author: 4fded3ad945b700aaa01381d

topics.body:
"@Grieffon":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5397d5e96368726d9f450400#post_5397d5e96368726d9f450400

I don't think that's ever been invoked. It's been more along the lines of "Aaron don't post that". Then I ask why and they say, "Well some of it isn't appropriate".

What the fuck are you talking about, vanilla tags is safe and suggestive, and none of it is horrible? You see just as "bad" in Avatar: The Last Airbender.


It's actually sort of amusing. All I got to do to get them to flip a lid is post a search result to a set of harmless tags and they go nuts. Some guy asked for wallpapers and I sent him the search result page for wallpapers. Then a mod came in and got mad at me.

I think he shut up when I challenged his ruling. But I couldn't tell since I auto-logged before he could respond and I don't care. But this is what happens when nerds get power, I guess.
topics.author: 4fe4bf947f123b175b000001

A lot of people hate us for some odd reasons.

like saying something about we have nothing but porn here when in actuality the Safe images fucking body the Explicit ones.

And the mods quickly tell people to fuck off when they're acting a fool.

They even go so far as to delete very inappropriate images like that troll who posted all those very offensive Michal joke images.

While some places don't even care.
topics.author: 50c204917f123b31440000a5

topics.body:
I know I posted about it the video game thread, but now that I think about it doesn't just apply to video games;


What I was talking about in the video game thread is how 2014-2020 is going to be revenge of the indie game cause 95% of the actual things to make video games, the scripts, the animation, the models and so forth you can now buy online for use in a for profit video game.

This doesn't just effect video games now that I think about it effects cgi and the movie industry as well.

There's a lot of cgi in movies; the problem potentially facing not only the video game industry, but the movie industry, tv industry and a couple other industries right now is that cost is going down and as a result more competition.  The problem with the movie and film industry is slightly different in that sales and viewership is steadily going down(sorry tv industry, but the internet is really killing the tv star); the problem with the video game industry is that now if you want a photo-realistic game you can have a photo-realistic game for cheap leading to a oversaturation and potentially AAA gaming getting fucked hard.

Tv can potentially fuck the movie theater and tv industry cause we're now seeing the rise of internet only shows that are just as good and for much cheaper.  Hell; if it wasn't for the internet the Halo movie would have never came to be even though for years fans were begging for it.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5397d7056368726d6d1e0500#post_5397d7056368726d6d1e0500

The LoE forums are all tight in their own ass too. I happened at one point to describe my adventures in an RP I run and I used "Dismember" in a metaphorical sense. As soon as I did that three people told me to stop and one person fought me on it.

They don't got much going on. I think at this point it's a survival challenge of how abrasive I can be to them before I get banned or they all drop the act, I think banned may be the first thing to happen, and that seems like a far way off. Nothing really worth discussion happens, and their live-chat often breaks down into RP'ing (which some users seem to think is like the fucking Holocaust happening before their eyes) or them trying to be bullshit cute with each other.

It's becoming quickly apparent that they're all kids anyways. The cool people that were around were banned the day I met them. Though I think there's one still lurking around, he's a Retsufan like myself so he's got points above the entire lot.

So I guess I'll keep poking in, being the masochist I am and running a cheese grader along their moral platform to see how long it takes for them to feel the burn or harden up and loosen their rules. It can't be healthy. And if I can maintain this until the next Open Server weekend without a perma, I've earned myself a drink
topics.author: 4fe4bf947f123b175b000001
